turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Commission internationale permanente pour l’épreuve des armes à feu portatives.
turn.1: What does the C.I.P.E. do with portable fire arms?
turn.2: As a result, the compulsory ammunition safety control tests by the manufacturers themselves and their approval by the proof houses are only pressure related.
turn.3: do they have any other functions?
turn.4: The dimensional checking of the ammunition, as described in the C.I.P. Decisions, Texts and Tables, is left to the manufacturers themselves.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Headspace is not checked, even on rimless cartridges with taper.
turn.8: The view is that in the very unlikely case (according to the current quality standards) the cartridge is too long, once pressed by the bolt, the pressure will rise too high causing rejection.
turn.9: what about if it's too short?
turn.10: If it is too short, firing will fail also causing rejection.
turn.12: The manufacturers do make velocity measurements, however.
